iShapes demo

1) Description

The iShapes demo is a graphical example of DDS usage. It is independent from Gateway.

It is actually one of the Vortex Café example of application, and thus it is compatible with Vortex OpenSplice when configured to use DDSI.

It defines a shape as a DDS type:

      struct ShapeType {
          string color;     // shape's color
          long x;           // shape's coordinate on X axis
          long y;           // shape's coordinate on Y axis
          long shapesize;   // shape's size
      }

And 3 topics to publish and consumes such DDS data: Circle, Square and Triangle

The iShapes demo can then be used to publish and/or subscribe moving shapes to/from those different topics.

Notes:

  • In above snapshot, the black-spotted shapes represent subscriptions, and the pierced shapes represent publications.
  • The "QoS" menu and the "Filter" menu are not implemented at this time.

WARNING: this demo uses JavaFX 2, and therefore requires Java 7 to run.

2) Running

Environment Setup

  • Make sure to have Maven executable (mvn) and Java 7 executable in PATH.
  • Make sure to have Vortex OpenSplice environment set (on Linux sourcing Vortex OpenSplice's release.com file).

Running the iShapes demo:

  • Run as many ishapes demo you want (some publishing shapes, some subscribing shapes) with following command:
    • on Linux/Unix: ./run-ishapes.sh
    • in Windows: run-ishapes.bat
